channel.title: Button

item.title: Button
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Okay…Posted this before…Didn’t get all the info I needed.

I need to know what to add where to make the action button I added to my new interface actually work when you click on it. I added it to my clickingMost class already. Not sure if this is server or client sided, so I posted here.

class9 code for interface and button (client):

[code] public static void YourInterface(Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4[] wid)
{
Class9 class9 = addTab(7700);

		addInterfaceSprite(999, 999, 999);

		addText(1001, "THIS IS A TEST", wid, 1, 0x000000);

		addActionButton(7000, 1000, 1000, 25, 30, "Kunai");





	class9.anInt261 = 0;
	class9.aBoolean266 = false;
	class9.anIntArray240 = new int[3];
	class9.anIntArray241 = new int[3];
	class9.anIntArray272 = new int[3];

		class9.anIntArray240[0] = 999;
		class9.anIntArray241[0] = 0;
		class9.anIntArray272[0] = 0;

		class9.anIntArray240[1] = 1001;
		class9.anIntArray241[1] = 5;
		class9.anIntArray272[1] = 6;

		class9.anIntArray240[2] = 7000;
		class9.anIntArray241[2] = 49;
		class9.anIntArray272[2] = 80;


}[/code]

And in my clickingMost it’s just set for a simple teleport as a test…Now…It does not do anything, how would I make it work? And where would I add my solution?

Read full topic
